title_desc: In elevated market, Warren Buffett is missing from the chatter. That doesn't mean his views are any less clear. Commentary: Judging by the record haul of cash he's hoarding, it's safe to assume he doesn't expect the market to remain elevated forever

'Stocks are overvalued': Wall Street heavyweights sound the alarm about markets. Legendary investors Stan Druckenmiller and David Tepper the latest to weigh in, saying risk-reward of holding shares worst they've seen in years
Stocks get hammered as bond market’s warning spooks investors. Dow tumbles 800 points; TSX down 300
What Alberta job losses in January mean for Edmonton. Statistics Canada says Alberta lost 19,000 jobs last month
Scotiabank profit tops estimates in revival of capital markets. Net income rises 3.5 per cent to $2.33 billion

Slack is planning for direct share listing instead of an IPO. Slack Technologies Inc. plans to forgo a traditional initial public offering and instead intends to sell its shares to bidders in a direct listing, a person familiar with the matter.
TSX falls from record high after a week of gains, U.S. markets mixed. I think this kind of a catch-your-breath moment for the markets, analyst said

China accuses Canada of violating bilateral agreement in Huawei arrest. Ottawa warned it could face ‘severe consequences’ if Wanzhou Meng not released immediately
Coronavirus puts a spotlight on the moral compass of America. The individualism the U.S. was founded on might not serve it well in the current public health crisis

CIBC’s 'day late and a dollar short' missteps turn investors off. Shifting strategies and inconsistencies have frustrated investors, including a mortgage misstep that saw CIBC go from leader to laggard in two years
